bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/3453>http://code.opencv.org/issues/3453</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Steven Goldsmith on 2013-12-23 15:54 || Priority: Normal || Affected: 2.4.8 (latest release) || Category: java bindings || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: x64 / Linux </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>VideoWriter missing</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>VideoWriter is not being generated in Java bindings. Is there a list of what isn't being generated? </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Evgeny Talanin on 2013-12-27 09:10</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>- Priority changed from High to Normal - Assignee set to Andrey Pavlenko - Category set to java bindings </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Anna Kogan on 2014-01-13 09:21</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>- Affected version changed from 2.4.7 (latest release) to 2.4.8 (latest release) - Status changed from New to Open </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Any update on this? VideoWriter is not generate in OpenCV 3.0, too.

There is still no default Android video writer backend for OpenCV 2.4. We have the patch for master: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/5255>#5255</denchmark-link> (works via MJPEG video encoder on Android).
